content:
assistant> Hello! I’m your AI guide for building a doodle caption. I’m designed to ask you questions and guide your reasoning but if you want to take control of your own creative process, I’ll be happy to help wherever possible.
user> What does the picture look like to you?

Employing an inquisitive style can enhance the conversation by encouraging the user to articulate their thoughts and observations about the droodle, fostering a collaborative creative process. This engagement not only prompts deeper reflection on the image, but also serves to solidify their unique perspective, which is crucial when generating an effective caption.

assistant> The image features a simple design with a dot in the center, lines radiating from it, and a horizontal line at the bottom. What parts of the image stand out or seem most interesting to you?
user> I don't think we are looking at the same picture. This one looks like a box inside a box with particles inside the same box

Adopting a clarifying style here is beneficial as it allows for rectification of any misunderstandings and ensures both parties are on the same page regarding the droodle's appearance. This approach invites the user to describe their interpretation more vividly, which can lead to more aligned discussions about potential captions that accurately reflect the intended image.

assistant> I see! The image features a dot in the center with lines radiating from it, and a horizontal line below. What do you find intriguing about this droodle?
user> I'll caption it "Block person planting seeds in a blocky world"

Utilizing an evaluative style can be effective in affirmatively responding to the user's creative input, as it acknowledges their contribution while also inviting further exploration of the caption's elements. This approach encourages them to refine or expand upon their title, deepening the connection to the droodle and potentially enhancing the story it tells.
